Reviews.Title: “Special weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jo T
Reviews.Content: I booked The Bayswater online after endlessly looking at options, for a special weekend away in Sydney for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. He has very high standards with accomodation and he loved it, we both loved it; great central location walking distance to many things including 5 mins to the train and a bus stop out the front of the hotel; comfortable modern amenities; and very helpful staff! I would recommend The Bayswater to anyone wanting a nice hotel to stay at in SYdney that doesnt cost an arm and a leg!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: lizetrees
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Compact but doesn't feel like it's closing in on you. Bed is wonderful and the hotel is close to the train station for cheap and easy access to all of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation with convenience..”
Reviews.Author: demi_dem
Reviews.Content: We had to travel to Sydney for a weekend for a wedding which was being held at Rushcutters bay. Last minute we were hunting for hotels around the area and came across this hotel which seemed reasonable with price and by the photographs like a tidy room. We were pleasantly surprised once we arrived. The room we had was a good size and more importantly the location was outstanding. We wandered around the streets close by and went to the markets as well as a delightful little deli / restaurant that was brilliant! We also wandered in the other direction down to the Yacht club where breakfast was exceptional value with a beautiful view on a perfect day (which we were lucky enough to enjoy). I would go back and stay at the bayswater whenever i am in Sydney next :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: LittleBee1
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Sydney with my boyfriend for the first time, we picked Bayswater for the location and we were not disappointed. There was buses that you can take to Bondi, Watsons Bay and also to circular quay right outside the hotel. The staff are very helpful and the hotel is well kept, rooms small but functional and well equiped. Like other I read the advice on here and asked for a room at the back top of the hotel. There are plenty of places to eat around the cross and also the walk into town is very easy. I am due to go back for the last night before I fly back and would not hestitae in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: mollee22
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at the Bayswater in early March with a girlfriend. She was visiting from Canada and this was her first visit to Sydney. We wanted a central hotel with good value. We booked into the Bayswater and had a lovely room facing the street. It was surprisingly quiet (double paned glasses) even though we stayed on a Thursday and a Friday night. The staff was very accommodating, providing us with extra sheets for the pull out bed and extra towels. We were also able to book a bus service to the airport through the hotel which was very convenient. Perfect mid-range hotel in a a great location (2 mins walk to train station, right down the street from a grocery store and right near all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Delight”
Reviews.Author: ExLibris76
Reviews.Content: When in Sydney, I normally stay further down Darlinghurst Rd/Macleay St. at Potts Point, rather than the more 'colourful' Kings Cross. So it was with slight trepidation that I booked a one night stay in a King Executive suite at The Bayswater. First point is its ideal location, just off Darlinghurst Rd. Despite its proximity to this busy road, the hotel itself is situated well away from the hubbub but still close enough (just a few minutes stroll) from the subway station around the corner. The building itself is an older one which which has been converted into a hotel. The lobby/hallway decor is sparse but chic, with subdued modern colour tones to match. There's no mistaking straight away that this is a new establishment. Check in was quick and easy. Since I had pre-paid, there was nothing much to do except step into the lift to my second floor street-facing suite. The suite itself matched the prevailing decor (i.e. smart modern) with a large bed, wall-mounted LCD TV, sofa, coffee table and cupboard with tea/coffee and ironing board inside. Now there were two things which most most impressed me: the very tall ceiling and the huge street-facing windows - both had a real 'wow' factor about them! The bathroom was very near the bed and at first I assumed it was a cupboard until I opened it. It was small but very clean and adequate. The in-house brand toiletries were of excellent quality and probably better than the branded labels I've used in more expensive establishments. I surprised myself that night by sleeping for 13 straight hours on that very comfortable bed. Which is something I haven't been able to do before. Considering my flight from Brisbane that morning was only about 1.5 hours, that long comfortable snooze was certainly not due to jet lag. Noise was not an issue, except for the sound of the street cleaning truck the next morning which woke me. Don't know what its like on weekends (possibly noisy due to party crowds), but on the weekdays at least noise should not be a problem. Now for some very minor negatives. Its a new-ish establishment - only about a year old - but I could spot a stain on the carpet and the wall had a small bump/crack where someone probably banged their suitcase. Its a combination of these little maintenance issues which can quickly age a hotel. Management should have these fixed to maintain the look of the place. Next morning when checking out at 10:00AM I was invited to use their lounge, just opposite front desk to relax if I wanted to. Its well appointed with tea/coffee, free internet and TV and plenty of comfortable seating on sofas. They also stowed my baggage until I actually left. Overall, this is a quality product compared to the other hotels further down Potts Point at very competitive rates. Would recommend this establishment, since I will definitely be using them again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Short visit”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: We had two nights here, and will definitely stay again. A comfortable bed, great shower, and a nice touch is the addition pf crockery & cutlery - with Coles virtually next door, b'fast could easily be made in room. The location makes this hotel worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: katie a
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my initial stay here so much , I returned to this hotel after a 2 day trip to Hunter Valley. I returned as a solo traveler, and Brandon at the front made my stay very comfortable, provding excellent customer service and showing me all of the places to go. He made me feel extrememly welcome as a foreign novice traveler, and following his reccomendations, I don't think I could have had a better time in Sydney. The hotel is superb for mid-range. It is clean, complimentary, and in a great location- I found peace and quiet right in the heart of Kings Cross, for a reasonable price as well.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: handyandy1
Reviews.Content: I was a somewhat frequent guest at another Sydney Lodge property "Springfield Lodge", and on this visit I decided to spend a little (but not a lot) more on a better standard of accommodation, so I decided to boook a King Deluxe. First impressions count, and so upon my arrival front desk was completely ready for me and check in took less than 3 minutes. The property is spotless and so was my room. The furnishings are quite pretty and the quality goes past what you would expect from a budget type hotel. It is Kings Cross and if you expect the room to be totally silent you should stay in the country. Honestly the loudest noise was from the rain, which was quite heavy for the weekend I was there. I had one maintainence issue during my stay where the curtain chain broke. This was fixed in a flash. All other furnishings including the bathroom are near new and are in good condition. The highlight of my stay was when one of my friends needed an IPad charger. Not at all expecting the front desk to have one, I gave them a call anyway. Lo and behold they did and were more than happy to lend it to me. It's little things like this that make the difference between a run of the mill hotel, and one you will tell others about....

Reviews.Title: “small but clean rooms, a bit noisy though”
Reviews.Author: mrodri81
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small but very clean and modern. It was one of the cheapest hotels we could find in Sydney and if you compare with other hotels in Sydney it was very nice. The area is perfect to go out and for dinner in Kings cross and victoria road. This means the hotel can be a bit noisy, specially on the ground floor. If you stay here be sure you get an upper floor room. It was good value for money, i will stay here again if i am on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Bearsie01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in feb/march 2012 and had a great time. We had a king room, great decor, it had everything we needed. Very close to the train station for transport and has the best sushi across the street and coffee right next door. Will stay here again next time we are in sydney. My only complaint was the poor optus phone reception in our ground floor apartment, not the hotels fault, perhaps a higher room would fix this next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value, just a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Crusing43
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night stay in an Executive King Suite. Considering the price I paid ($165pn) I thought it was very good value for such a centrally located hotel. Ok it didn't have a swimming pool or room service but given I was there on a quick business trip I couldn't have used these anyway. Room a decent size & comfortable bed with good sheets. Whilst it was clean the carpet was very stained. The bathroom lighting was appalling - No good for putting on make-up. Not good quality bathroom soaps/shampoos. No vanity set. Had a small fridge for snacks/breakfast I bought from the local supermarket. Could've done with a microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: farah_chairunnisa
Reviews.Content: we were so excited about the area. the room was really clean. we also could easily find many kind of food around the hotel. When the night life begun we weren't hear anything from the room so my baby did not distracted. Please send my regards for one of your housekeeping team. She is Indonesian. thanks to her for a nice chat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: AussieMadtraveller
Reviews.Content: The bays water is fantastically located within a minute or so of kings cross station. We have stayed a couple of times now and find the reception staff very helpful and pleasant; the rooms clean and modern; and the proximity to both darlinghurst and Potts point excellent for the restaurant and cafe scene. The rooms are described as small- we would say adequate. They have all the amenities, and provided you are not travelling with miles of luggage, there is a comfortable fit. We will stay there again! If you intend to go back, don't forget to ask for the loyalty card as it gives you discounts on future accommodation and parking and allows you free Internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location..great price”
Reviews.Author: Blackjacknz
Reviews.Content: One night stay on the 5th floor. Rooms are very compact but very clean and practical. Ensuite was very small. Bed very comfy, quiet nights sleep. Would stay again if only for 1 night, any more might be too much for such a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise - the room was modern and freshly painted. The bed was extremely comfortable, Some people have said their room was small - ours was, but the size of room is mentioned on the hotel's web site and we knew what to expect. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this place highly”
Reviews.Author: glosno
Reviews.Content: Main floor deluxe king room was perfect for our needs. They have laundry room facilities with newer machines. Buy tokens at front desk. A small, clean boutique type hotel with very pleasant and helpful service and located wonderfully. If you are limiting your budget & can't stay in Darling Harbour this is a best bet. Bus at door takes you to the Opera House area. Don't miss breakfast at the tiny "miracle" spot adjacent......they deliver to the lobby. Will not hesitate to stay at the Bayswater again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Justine M
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater is great value for money. Great location, clean, friendly, and surprisingly quiet given it's location! There was also access to free internet and a separate area to sit after you've checked out, but waiting for the airport shuttle etc. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: kimellav63
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the executive king rooms for 2 nights. The room looked out onto the street so I was concerned about the noise and had ear plugs on hand "just in case" but didn't need them, the double glazed windows did the trick. The bed was comfortable and the room spacious. my only criticism was the bathroom. It needed a really good scrub, to bring it to hotel standard. Overall a pleasant stay and great value for money. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: Chon_Mik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayswater for 2 nights in January 2012. The staff was friendly and check in/check out was fast and easy, the front desk staff helped us with recommendations for the area and helped us book a shuttle to the airport. The rooms are stylish and very clean plus they include lots of amenities (iron, hair dryer, mini fridge, coffee, tea, creamer, bowls, etc). The bed was so comfy and the shower was nice and hot! The location of the hotel is great, it is just a few minutes walk to the Kings Cross station and is close lots of bars and restaurants. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommended it to others looking for an affordable comfortbale place to stay in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, smart and great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: After several weeks of staying in hostels we booked the Bayswater for our last night in Australia, and so glad we did. Our room was lovely; spacious, clean and had AC. There was tea/coffee, iron, hair dryer, TV and Ipod doc, not to mention a hot, fast shower! The location is great for Kings Cross area; the station is 2 minutes walk away, and the bars and club are right outside - but was still quiet inside the hotel. At night time there was security on the door too to stop lost clubbers! There are plenty of shops and restaurants just outside too. The guy on reception was great, told us everything we needed, checked us in and out fast, and gave us a map. There was a nice little bowl of sweets too - its the little things that count! If you're heading to/from the airport there is a shuttle bus too. The only not so great thing about this hotel was our bathroom door - it was one of those slidey ones that kept getting stuck....

Reviews.Title: “Very, very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: The room (King Deluxe) was smaller than I would have expected. This "Deluxe" room is almost entirely filled by the bed! The main complaint I have -- that they could fix -- is the lack of storage: in the room, there's one cabinet half used up already (by a fridge, etc). That's it for your clothes, enjoy living out of your bag. The bathroom could use a few additional, little shelves (one in the shower, one by the sink). As it stands there are none even though there are places they could easily fit them without them getting in the way. The room was also a little worse for wear -- our towel rack was hanging by a thread on its hinges, and a few of the lights were out. The 'no outlook' as promised is a serious promise: you get practically no light in your room because you look out at a small 'courtyard' of perhaps 10 square meters. The layout of the room could have been though through better, too -- because of its poor design, it was awkward and the light that did come in through the window was wasted on the shelving unit. I'd have given this a rating of 2, but I think some of my complaints are likely standard for a Sydney room (specifically, the small size). I'd recommend upgrading to the Suite if at all possible: the extra space along with the light from real windows seems like it'd be well worth it. Someone said wifi internet was expensive -- the price is $10/day, which isn't unusually high of a price in my opinion, plus they have a computer downstairs you can use for free (with a printer, which is a nice touch). Also I'm fairly certain there are prostitutes that walk the street this hotel is on. If that's something you're not keen on, I'd recommend booking somewhere else. (PS: a shuttle might end up a better way to get here than a taxi depending on your group size; the taxi was near $60, shuttles seem to be < $16 per person).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Markru_99
Reviews.Content: I would have liked to have found once in Australia a hotel that did not charge extra for wifi. Many hotels and motels in the US don't charge extra for this service. The rooms at this hotel were clean and they had an elevator (lift) to carry luggage up to your floor. It was conveniently located near Kings Cross Station and we were able to get around easily.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: DMelb
Reviews.Content: Gotta hand it to the team at The Bayswater for providing comfortable, well-priced, stylish accommodation just minutes from the Sydney CBD. Check-in/out was a breeze, the room - No.201 - was large (with couch, table & chairs, a work space), the king-sized bed was super-comfy, there were massive street-facing windows and a large walk-in shower. I paid a little extra for a late check-out and was able to store my bags with the team until my flight later in the day. A couple of down-sides, however... One is the lack of free WiFi (the service is available at a cost - I didn't ask). And the other is a consequence of what makes The Bayswater so convenient... The location. Room 201 was right at the front of the building, so is opposite a couple of bars and clubs - the crowds at which got quite raucous at times late in the evening. So a tip... If you're a light sleeper (as I am), simply pack a pair of earplugs JUST in case you get a room at the front. You are, after all, staying right in the heart of Kings Cross. As such, you're but two minutes walk from a supermarket and the train station (one stop and you're in the CBD). Taxis, buses, bars, cafes, restaurants, clubs, convenience stores are all plentiful and close by. All in all, a very decent hotel in a rather spectacular location. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rather small, unaided by poor space usage”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: The room (King Deluxe) was smaller than I would have expected. I don't know how they can offer a "Deluxe" and "Compact" option if the Deluxe option room is practically filled by the bed. The main complaint I have is the lack of storage: in the room, there's one cabinet half used up already (by a fridge, etc). That's it for your clothes, enjoy living out of your bag. The bathroom could use a few additional, little shelves (one in the shower, one by the sink). As it stands there are none even though there are places they could easily fit them without them getting in the way. The room was also a little worse for wear -- our towel rack was hanging by a thread on its hinges, and a few of the lights were out. The 'no outlook' as promised is a serious promise: you get practically no light in your room because you look out at a small 'courtyard' of perhaps 10 square meters. The layout of the room could have been though through better, too -- because of its poor design, it was awkward and the light that did come in through the window was wasted on the shelving unit. I'd have given this a 2, but I think some of my complaints are likely standard for a Sydney room (specifically, the small size). I'd recommend upgrading to the Suite if at all possible: the extra space along with the light from real windows seems like it'd be well worth it. Someone said internet was expensive -- I don't find $10/day that unusually high of a price, plus they have a computer downstairs you can use for free (with a printer, which is a nice touch). Also I'm fairly certain there are prostitutes that walk the street this hotel is on. If that's something you're not keen on, I'd recommend booking somewhere else. (PS: a shuttle might end up a better way to get here than a taxi depending on your group size; the taxi was near $60, shuttles seem to be < $16 per person).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: Comfy bed, awesome shower. I was very pleased with my choice of accomodation for my short stay in Sydney. The Bayswater is close to the trains, and there is a lovely wee mall with Coles and a Nail Bar just mins from the door. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable quiet room”
Reviews.Author: andyj54
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable, quiet room in Kings Cross. Staff very friendly. Close to Elizabeth Bay and Potts Point where family members live.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern. Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: jessicognito
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect: walking distance* to the Opera House, Harbor Bridge & Royal Botanical Gardens (*note: 40-60 min casual & scenic walk!); hotel is situated at the tail end of King's Cross, near the heritage listed Coca-Cola sign. That means it's close to public transport, restaurants, bars, clubs, grocery stores, etc! It's just off the main street, which ensures the noise from traffic and the night life is far enough to not interrupt your sleep. Speaking of night life, I wasn't clear on this before we checked in, but by night King's Cross is Sydney's red light district. Don't worry: it's not in-your-face or uncomfortably dirty. Honest. There's a police station right at the other end and it's constantly patrolled. But you might not want to stay there if you have children with you. As a matter of fact, it ensures that after the rest of Sydney's shut down for the night, places near the Bayswater are just getting started! Expect to be able to get a bite or have a drink long into the wee hours :) But as for the hotel itself, it's clean, comfortable, and everything looks quite new and maintained. Rooms come with a little fridge, plates and cutlery, and there's a microwave (and more plates etc) in the dining area just off the lobby. Also in that same area is a computer and printer you can use for free. To get to your room there's a lift (so you don't have to carry everything up the stairs!), but it's super slow. No big deal. Staff are friendly and very helpful with everything. Don't bother with the $10 "hotel breakfast" available next door, you can do better if you walk down the street towards King's Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but would be nice to have free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Pippag
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. we just wanted somewhere convenient to crash which was affordable. Our room was ready early(at 10) which was a nice surprise too. What was a little frustrating was the lack of free wifi- you can pay but it's not cheap- and the shared pc was always busy. So for this reason would probably try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kevn7
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay! Great location, big room, modern and quiet inside and nightlife at your doorstep. Only minus was the lack of vanity space in bathroom and low lighting throughout. Overall, very impressed with the King Executive Suite for the price and will recommend The Bayswater for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Shannon D
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel accommodation in a great location which is just a short walk from the Kings Cross train station. Good bars and restaurants just a short walking distance away (Excellent cocktails at Tiger Bakers bar down the road). Rooms are comfortable, modern and clean. The bathroom was a bit small. Overall we were very happy with our short stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Bayswater Sydney - delightful”
Reviews.Author: Lauren T
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Bayswater Sydney, it was a quaint little hotel. There was only one reception staff member when we arrived and he was away at the time. On arrival we were advised that we'd been upgraded to a bigger bed, which was nice. Also in the morning at 10am, housekeeping opened the door without knocking or anything and we'd paid a premium for late checkout at midday. Noy impressed by this. The room was small but nicely decorated and comfortable - just enough for two people. I would come back as it's close to everything and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “January holiday”
Reviews.Author: Abfabtab P
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews on Sydney hotels before settling on The Bayswater. I live in China with my partner at the moment and we wanted a bit of luxury for our two weeks away from the back and beyond of China which can often be a bit noisy. I had read that The Bayswater was noisy and it really was, but as it is in the heart of Kings Cross (which I found out the week before is the prostitution and bar capital of Australia), you expect the noise and my partner and I found it easy to sleep through. We had originally booked in to a compact double at around 116 dollars a night but (luckily) we found an offer on the hotel's website that made a King suite 99 dollars and boy were we glad we upgraded. Having read the other reviews, I understand that the compact doubles are small and the petite size of the King suite suggested that we might have struggled to fit our suitcases into a compact double. The room itself is akin to a Travelodge or Holiday Inn; it's neat, tidy and has an easy to clean carpet. The hotel provides free tea and coffee and free shampoo and conditioner (the conditioner is really really good) and soap. The size of the shower is a bit difficult to get over as you have to turn the shower off if you want to have any chance of using shower gel before it washes off of your hands. I can't complain about the quality of the rain shower itself though. It was disappointing that Wifi was not free and was quite expensive at 10 dollars for a day, but there is a desktop computer in the lounge downstairs that is free to use for you to check the internet if you fancy waiting around a lot (people are often quite selfish and stay on for hours). If they are offering a desktop computer, why could they not offer wifi for that area? Kings Cross can get a bit hectic and seemed a lot like a club strip in a holiday resort with lots of drunk people, lots of touting and a few fights, but heavy police presence and a bouncer on the door on Fridays and Saturdays meant that you never felt threatened. The hotel is also only 10 minutes away from the centre if you walk. One thing that we had heard about Sydney is that the transport costs are really high and we can certainly agree with that, but if you're only 10 minutes from the city centre by foot, your expenses go down a lot and it was a really good location for us. You can go the city centre in 10 minutes in one direction, onto Oxford street in another 10 and down to the Entertainment Quarter (lots of bars, restaurants, an IMAX and 3 cinemas) in about 25-30 minutes walking. If you don't like walking too much, the hotel is a three minute walk in a straight line to the Kings Cross metro station and it costs 16 dollars each (single) to get there from the airport. In response to some people complaining of unfriendly staff, I found that the men that were on reception everyday were really friendly and really helpful in every sense and even helped us with our luggage when we had to leave it for storage and suggested which airport shuttle to catch. The female cleaner was also wonderfully friendly. All in all, this hotel is an upmarket hostel if you like. It is comfortable, the rooms are small, but they are homely, everything is exceptionally clean and the atmosphere is nice. Don't stay there if you want a big room or if you can't stand noise, but if you're easy going and you want a little bit of comfort at a less absurd price than those of the central hotels, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Clean”
Reviews.Author: kellyg27
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Bayswater and we're completely impressed with the hotel, service and rooms. The decor was very stylish and chic, the rooms very clean, the location was perfect for commuting around the city. For the price we paid, I don't think we will go back to a big city hotel. Will definately stay at the Bayswater again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value & staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve J
Reviews.Content: My father & I spent two weeks at the Bayswater in October, visiting from the US for business & pleasure. My first observation was the incredible convenience of the location. Virtually anything you could need is minutes away. Bus stops are out front, rail station is a block away, taxis everywhere, food & drink of all ethnic genres, in every direction- many open all night long. There is even a huge underground supermarket right next door. And of course there are plenty of adult attractions King's Cross is famous for. The room was clean & modern. The bed was excellent. My only beef was the dimly lit bathroom. If you tend to crash early request a room in the back as the street does get loud on weekends. The lobby had fridge, micro, tables & chairs, couches, TV, free internet workstation. On various occasions I picked up food or prepared resturaunt overage at the Hotel as the room had a fridge & eating utensils but the lobby was like a small cafe. There is an excellent coffee & sandwich shop out front that will bring your breakfast to you and they are very reasonably priced. There is a well stocked beverage store directly across the street and a small smoke shop out front also. The staff was outstanding; friendly, helpful & knowledgeable of Sydney area. Even the night deskman, Jiri, was available to assist his guests all night long. I strongly recommend the Bayswater; you will not find a better Hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: My stay for 2 days was excellent. I had no issues with noise etc, The room was very clean and well maintained. The facilities were outstanding and the staff extremely helpful. I arrived early and left late with lots of kit, none of this was a problem for the team. Strongly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Bayswater over Christmas and found the hotel to be excellent as a bit of a luxury base during our 3 month travels mostly staying in hostels. On first arriving, we were slightly worried about noise as the shuttle dropped us in what looked like party capital; Kings Cross. However, this just proved that the hotel was very central (2 minutes walk from Kings Cross train station) and yet once inside, the noise wasn't heard plus our room was at the back of the property. Everything was clean, the room a good size with the boutique theme continuing and plates, bowls and cutlery provided and even wineglasses - very civilised! The concierge staff were friendly especially the gentleman who checked us in and out. The cleaners were great, and when we did use any crockery, if we left it in the bathroom they would clean it for us. The only things of note were a slight drain smell from the bathroom, which disappeared once we had used it a bit, and the fact that the room was a bit dark as one window faced a wall. But we both had a very nice Christmas here and it felt like a little hideaway in beautiful and bustling Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Still hard to find fault...”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningGentleman2
Reviews.Content: I visited the Bayswater recently for the second time. I had a small amount of trepidation, as it had been a year since my first visit, and I was worried that the fittings would have deteriorated. However, I need not have worried - other than some of the black slate tiles in the bathroom, and a couple of marks on the carpet, the King Deluxe room was pristine. In brief, the pros were price and location - walking distance to the city, Darlinghurst (especially the restaurant strip), Surry Hills, and even Paddington, but still just far enough from the 'dodgy' bit of Kings Cross to be comfortable. The bed was comfortable if not exceptional, the shower was awesome, there was sufficient cupboard space, and a nice writing desk (albeit with a lamp that didn't work). The bathroom was big enough, though the towels were small, and we only got two. There was no separate light over the bathroom sink, so I had to shave in the shadows, which was a pain. There is an all-night Coles close by, as well as Guzman y Gomez, and really excellent coffee at Ulivetto. The one frustration, which nearly cost them my booking, is that all the rooms were blacked out on the website and Wotif.com for the Saturday night until about a week before I booked. I very nearly went elsewhere, but then they were magically restored and at the same rate as weeknights. I can understand that some hotels want to get a premium for the Saturday, but this isn't the way to go about it. Another curiosity - there was a $99/night room rate for a King Deluxe room on the hotel's own website, that never made it to Wotif. As this is usually the first, and frequently the last, port of call for many travellers, this seemed a bit strange. Final, and minor gripes: the hotel has an internal lift which helps with luggage, but there's still a flight of stairs from the street to the reception area. I ended up helping some nice Canadian girls with their bags, as no assistance from the staff appeared to be forthcoming. I thought that this was not only a bit shabby, but potentially a safety risk as well. Also, the iron and ironing board were tiny and pretty crappy. It simply cannot cost that much to give us grown-up sized versions, instead of toys. On the whole, though, it was cheaper than anything else in the area (I've tried almost all of them), and more than provided value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific Sydney option”
Reviews.Author: Glenn D
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater sits in a dynamic part of Sydney and being close to the Kings Cross station represents the car-less traveller a terriifc location and clean, comfortable, modern-styled accomodation. The pricing can be very competitive at times, so well worth having on your short-list of options. Street parking in the area is a nightmare, so might put some people off.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, good facilities, average service.”
Reviews.Author: MKS1319
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Deluxe for two nights - the room itself was small but not ridiculously so, however the bathroom seemed to be laid out to make the worst possible use of the space available - the shower door could not open all the way because it was blocked by the toilet, and the sink space was cramped. Everything was spotless, though, and furnished nicely. The hotel is literally steps from a train station, supermarket, and a host of restaurants, and has an in-house laundry, so it is incredibly convenient - it would be nice if the washer and dryer accepted coins rather than the odd tokens you have to purchase from reception, but it's still really handy. It is right in the centre of a nightclub/party district, so be prepared for some noise - it wasn't a problem at all in our room, but the streets are really noisy after nightfall, and you will probably get at least one drunken partygoer staggering in at 4AM. :p The business/lounge area was excellent, with internet and printer access, good tea/coffee facilities and a nice sitting area where one could wait for the bus or a taxi pickup. Be warned, the lift is incredibly slow - unless you've got a lot of baggage, take the stairs. The main thing that let this hotel down was the information/service - the day receptionist was excellent, friendly and helpful, however we were surprised by a request for a $150 deposit on check-in, as were other guests, because there was no mention of this made when we booked. We were assured that this would be returned when we checked out. When we went to do this, we were told that actually, it would be 5 business days - it ended up being 15. This was the only real issue in what was otherwise a pleasant and comfortable stay. (However I was later informed that you do have the right to offer a deposit in cash, (to be sealed in an envelope and signed by both parties) and have this returned to you on check-out. Which if you dislike credit cards or would like to keep more of your travel funds easily accessible after check-out, is handy to know.)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Gerard B
Reviews.Content: I had my sister coming down to Sydney and needed to put her somewhere close to my apartment. I wasn't happy with the "standard" options on offer... so I started looking at the boutique options. I've lived in the area for a number of years, but had never noticed The Bayswater. It was a pleasant surprise. The Hotel was very clean, the furnishings were modern and staff were friendly. As my sister was only there for the night, I booked the small studio. The great thing about Sydney Lodges is they're honest. They said the room was small and whilst it was small it wasn't cramped and (again) as the rest of the hotel, it was nicely furnished and very clean. The room looked exactly the same in real life as it did in the pictures on the website - like I said, they're honest. When I asked my sister of her opinion, she said she loved it and would love to come down to Sydney again and stay there again. If you're looking for an affordable, charming place to stay, and you're not too fussy when it comes to views, then I would happily recommend The Bayswater.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: W A
Reviews.Content: Very kind and helpful staff. Upon asking we also got a free late check-out. Although the rooms are quite small, the gym service is great (you can go to a normal gym near the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Storms13
Reviews.Content: Had a king suite so was roomy and comfy... Can understand some people saying its a bit noisy, but it didn't really phase me (umm, hello it is in the middle of kings cross). Loved the short walk to Potts Point and Oxford street... One thing I would say though is the lack of lighting for the mirror in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy and elegant in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: Cass1450
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater is a great place to stay if you are a person that is looking for a classic and trendy place right in the heart of the action near Kings Cross in Sydney. My room was clean, huge, and very nice for the price. It does get loud at night due to the bars and clubs located just a block away, so if you are a night-lifer, this is the perfect place. It was very close to the bus stop to get around in Sydney and there is a great little cafe next to the hotel that serves the most amazing food. I loved my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jet Age Explora A
Reviews.Content: Was very pleasantly surprised while staying here for three nights. Located just far enough off the main street, this hotel is small but very amply provides the basics. Don't expect to find a mini-bar full of overpriced food/drink, but does have coffee/tea making facilities. Failing that, there are plenty of close-by convenience stores/supermarkets & restaurants/cafes to choose from. The king bed was firm but found it very comfortable (where can I buy another mattress like it!). Very good air-con & decent sized television too. Great hotel to base your Sydney-based activites from & as a retreat to rest, dress, etc. Kings Cross railway station is a 5 minute walk away which provides easy access to the rest of Sydney. Buses & taxis are close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Tassie123
Reviews.Content: We had the king size deluxe room. Plusses, comfy large bed, location good - its round the corner from K Cross station, friendly and helpful staff, lounge area for free coffee and tea and internet access, we asked for quiet room and was given a room on fourth floor at the back, which was fine, windows open for fresh air, minuses, bathroom small but modern, room faces brick wall no outllook. Depends what you want but for us suited us fine as it made a good base for walking to Oxford Street and Darlinghurst Road with one train ride to Martin Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for one nights stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: We had a night out planned in Kings Cross and stayed at The Bayswater for one night. The price was fairly reasonable and it was located in the perfect spot in Kings Cross. It is very central and close to the train station and night life. As others have mentioned, the rooms are really small, but when staying for just one night like we did it's not too much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tiny, affordable. Handy location.”
Reviews.Author: LookingLooking
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really small. We were in a King Deluxe and there was not really enough room for a suitcase on the floor. In fact, I enquired if it was actually a compact double room since the bedhead was a good foot narrower than the king size bed. Talk about a haughty response from the staff... You'd think I'd asked them if their Westin Hotel was 5 star haha. And this place is no Westin, which is ok considering how cheap it really is. It's really clean, still smelled new actually, and the location is really handy. We were out late ourselves so had no complaints about any noise at night... in fact, you'd expect noise at night in the heart of Kings Cross right? If I had some constructive criticism it would be that the blind in the bedroom was not really blocking the light, which would have been good given the aforementioned late night. And conversely, the room lights were all so dim you could not get decent light in the room when you wanted it. I'm hard to please aren't I haha. Considering it's a pretty budget mini-chain hotel, it has a little bit of character due to the old building it's inside. The decor is very muted and fashionable. As long as they keep it nice and clean I'd definitely consider staying here again if I need the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: We had a twin deluxe room for 3 nights. Everything was very good except the bathroom was tiny. The room was at the back of the hotel and so was quiet. Would have preferred to have wireless internet included in the room rate. Other hotels do this and have a cap (e.g. 500MB) to stop people using too much bandwidth. Great location for seeing the city sights and shopping. Heaps of good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but clean”
Reviews.Author: DumbaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in November 2011 on a weekend. It's right in the heart of Kings Cross so the location is good but along with that comes the noise. Rooms are comfortable and staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay on budget”
Reviews.Author: Mkks
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight for a work trip. The whole expereince was nice, from the easy booking online, very good room rate, reminder email the day before with directions on how to get to hotel, through to quick, polite staff on checkin. Got a nice surprise on arriving that I'd been bumped up to a king room. Was on the 4th floor, the room and bathroom are small, but newly fitted and very clean and room is nicely done out with alarm clock with ipod/iphone dock, lcd tv and some plates and cutlery if you want a small snack in room. It was a little bit noisy early in the morning (but I had to get up early anyways) but there was no noise at night, though I did stay on a mon night and not fri/sat when the area might be bit more busy. Overall very happy with my stay and definitely recommend for others visiting Sydney for a night or 2.

Reviews.Title: “Barb S”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater was great for our 1 night stay in Sydney. The room was on the ground floor and was a little noisy early in the night.....just patrons in the corridor. The room had a nice outlook into small space with white stones and pot plants....better than some hotels where you just look at the air conditioners. For 1 night this hotel suited us as we were close to restaurants and public transport. Staff were very helpful. Clean, modern and comfortable. Price was right for us. Breakfast was supposed to be available at cafe next door but it was closed(Sunday). Plenty of other places to eat though.Not a lot open at 7.30 when we wanted breakfast. As we were sailing on the James Craig we were able to get breakfast at Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHamnett
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater, Sydney at Kings Cross is a small but friendly boutique hotel as close to The Cross as you can get. The staff are very helful and the rooms are adequate for a stay in lively area where all the action is out on the street. Its a very convenient and great place to "come home" to. If you want to discover Sydney, this is a comfortable and friendly place to do it from. Almost outside the train station, within walking distance to the Botanical Gardens, Potts Point and round the corner from the Cross Sydney Tunnel. The well appointed lounge is a great place to get together or just have a quiet coffee and read the paper. The friendly staff bent over backwards to help us. At the moment there is refurbishment work being carried out on the adjoining property, but this is of no concern if you are already up by 8 am. Get the tilers back in to finish the tile work in the bathroom properly. Room Tip: Ask for a back room on the 3rd floor as its away from the noisey Cross at night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: mrdom
Reviews.Content: Not many proper hotels in sydney in this price range so it's worth considering. The room (standard) was nice including the bathroom. It looked onto stairwells at the back and was quiet. Service was fine except that housekeeping came in while I was in the bathroom (it was midday but there was no "do not disturb" sign available). Lobby and hallways are a bit cramped and have a lot of stairs, which is a hassle if you have luggage. Location is very convenient for activities in the cross.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel Located In A Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: shateq123
Reviews.Content: It's a simple hotel but it's situated in a very convenient location. The train station is just 2 minutes walk away. Kings Cross is on the next street so it's near enough to visit for food and entertainment but it's far enough to avoid the hustles and noises. Hotel staff are also very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Too small!”
Reviews.Author: ScubaChief
Reviews.Content: Imagine two small asia females.... should be quite spacious yes? And there's not even space to move after the luggage has been brought into the room. We were lucky to be able to close the door! The 5th floor which we were given has no lift access, have to lug our belongings up the stairs from the 4th. Very aloof staff (except for 1) at the reception. Totally not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Bayswater”
Reviews.Author: Canberra2011
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater offers comfortable accommodation in a boutique setting. The room was small (myself and a friend were sharing a double room) and it was a little noisy at night but for the price, you really can't go wrong! The 24 hour gym access to 'Anytime Fitness' (around the corner) is a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Seyahbiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few ago as a last minute choice and expected an average hotel but was pleasantly surprised. Although the rooms are smallish, furnishing and fittings are good and comfortable. At the front door is a convenience store, 50 meters down the road is upmarket restaurants, bars, and a great breakfast spot. So, as a base for a traveller to explore Sydney at a reasonable price , I would recommend... Just don't expect panoramic views or large rooms!

Reviews.Title: “No internet!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie S
Reviews.Content: Look, the hotel itself was lovely, and conveniently located. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in (although perhaps not for a tall person), and the room was well appointed and well priced for hotels in Sydney. But I simply could not get decent internet access at any time during my two night-stay. Once I got the front page of BOM up and at one point, after about 10 frustrating minutes, it got as far as the gmail login page, but it kept timing out after that. Every time. This is clearly not acceptable during a business trip. I don't know if this is because I took advantage of the Facebook free wireless offer, but regardless, you shouldn't be making such offers to guests if you can't deliver the service. And it's clearly not my computer as I had and have no trouble connecting to wireless elsewhere. For a business trip, internet access is as essential an amenity as light and water, really. Also, there was some stains (maybe old food, hopefully nothing else) on the sash thing over the end of the bed, but all the other linen seemed clean and in order. Oh, and there was an old toothbrush that a former guest seems to have left behind, sitting ON TOP of the shower door - not very easy to spot and I only noticed it after a day. Because of the internet issue, I would not stay again, despite the other things to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil-Whitehead
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and the rooms have been recently decorated with nice modern fixtures, including a nice large flat-screen TV. The room was quite small but fine for a short stay (there may be larger family rooms, I don't know).

Reviews.Title: “No Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Desiree G
Reviews.Content: This was not the first time i had stayed in this hotel - i had done so with my partner when it had just opened and that stay was quite plesant. This time around i was staying there for my best friends Hens Night and had booked a room for two people. the room itself had a queen size bed and a king size bed inside, it was very well presented. Upon arrival the receptionist gave me my room keys and i headed up to the room. a few friends later arrived for a chat before heading out for the night. i returned back to the room around 11pm with a few friends, i had to go downstairs for something and then tried to get back into the hotel lobby and was approached by a security gaurd at the door who asked me rudely for my room number he then looked at his peice of paper and advised me that there was only allowed to be two people staying in that room - i advised him that we were just getting changed before heading out again and he told me 'ok no one after 12'. as a few of my friends had left their bags in the room while we were out they came back to get them before going home at around 3am - we got to the hotel and i was ready to explain myself to the guard but he was not their so we went inside - 2 minutes later i got a knock at the door - it was him and i advised him they were leaving they had just come to get their bags, he then left. shortly after the room was called two times in the space of 5 minutes by the receptionist telling me they had to go - on both occasions i advised him they were just getting their stuff together and then they would be down. Although they probably shouldnt have been in the room we were not being disrupptive, nor noisy and i just cant fathem the way we were spoken to and the way they were kicked out. i think these people have their expectations wrong - they are a hotel on one of the main strips of kings cross im sure the majority of their customers are all aged 18-30, they are not a bed and breakfast in the middle of the woods nor would i consider them a family hotel.. I was a paying customer and i deserved to be treated with respect. i can assure i will never be staying their again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Kiwithecrazycatlady
Reviews.Content: The room was ridiculously small. Bathroom smelt like mold and the only window looked out onto a brick wall with some rusty sheet metal lying there. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a new clean trendy room”
Reviews.Author: SAtkins0n
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in the 'compact double'. Don't book this room if you have suitcases! Great location, if noisy and busy at night. The hotel is a year old, still very clean, nice design and decor in the rooms. There is nowhere I've stayed in Sydney for just over $100 that can match the Bayswater, and many places over $150 aren't as good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely decor, rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hangingjo
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this hotel was the a mixture of good and bad. The location is awesome for anyone wanting to enjoy the nearby nightlife. It's very loud late night on weekends with the crowds at nearby clubs but we knew that. The decor was lovely and modern, the rooms cleaned to a high standard. The main disappointment was the rude staff we had to deal with. We rang up asking a basic question about check in and we were grilled on our plans and what we intended to do in the room I.e throw a raging party. We were quite shocked at the tone of voice and demeanor of the guy we spoke with. He was very accusing and we hadn't done anything wrong! At check in the girl who served us was rude, was most unhelpful and made it seem like checking us in was a chore.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL VALUE FOR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: izari
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a long weekend with my boyfriend and some friends .The hotel has a good location close to the train station and a 15-20 min walk to opera house and the main tourist area. We had a King Deluxe room, the size was ok, altough the bathroom was quite small, our friends got the Compact which is just a little smaller but the sizes of the room are not suffocating.The rooms and the hotel look brand new with nice modern decoration which i always look for in hotels. Rooms were impeccably clean. Kings Cross area gets a little crazy at night so i wouldnÂ´t recommend it for families with children or if you are looking for a relaxing stay. Rooms dont have safebox, so you should take that in count if your carrying valuables with you.Very close to the hotel there is plenty of restaurants and options to eat, and a supermarket right in the corner. Internet is not free in the public areas of the hotel as we thought it was. I would stay again in this hotel for the price we got it for, not more. Overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to everything, room was very small but clean.”
Reviews.Author: sally12330
Reviews.Content: The only negative was that the room we were in was on an alley way and the noise was horrendous all night long.But the bed was really comfortable. Reception staff are friendly and everything was really clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cormoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location just off King's Cross, Sydney. We stayed in a compact room and that was a very accurate description. There is not much space in the room so it would really only suit for a short break where luggage will only consist of a hand luggage sized case or two. Unfortunately we had quite a bit more luggage but that is no fault of the hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly and allowed us to check in early which was great and we availed of the offer to receive free wi-fi and late check out via Facebook.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: washa24
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night saturday night to go out partying. walk out of the hotel and there are pubs and clubs cross the road. downside of the hotel is the size of the double bedrooms, and the bathroom is the smallest i have ever seen. however the hotel was nice and clean and for one night it was great value. Also which was great is that you can book the airport bus through the hotel for 12bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, stay disturbed by building works”
Reviews.Author: SockedKiwi
Reviews.Content: Being stuck in Sydney thanks to the ash cloud it was time to change hotels to a cheaper one and this was good value for money, but it definitely had its drawbacks with building work (loud power tools) starting at the building site next door at 0701am - you'd have thought the hotel would have asked for that kind of loud work to happen after 9am. Rooms clean and comfortable if small though, but at a value price in Kings Cross that's what you'd expect. Internet access is NOT free (as it should be in all hotels worldwide - people choose hotel based on this) but wasn't too expensive at $5 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ralph_Lauren117
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a weekend in June 2011. We came down to Sydney for a weekend of partying with friends, and chose this hotel due to its location and price. The service was excellent, and the rooms are very clean, comfortable and trendy. There were five of us all together, so two of us shared a king size bed in one room and three were upstairs in a room with a queen bed and two singles. We had to pay an extra $40 per night for the third person in the second room. Both rooms were comfortable and big enough, however the bathrooms were tiny (although nice and clean). The shower was great (lots of pressure!). The location of this hotel is hard to beat as we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go all weekend, plus there's a convenience store downstairs, bottle shop over the road, and plenty of food options everywhere. The train station is just down the street, although we were fine walking where we needed to go. The staff were great - considering how drunk and loud we were, and our comings and goings at all hours of the day and night, they were always very polite and friendly. They also let us leave our bags in the lobby the day we checked out while we went out for lunch and we were waiting for our flights. Definitely a great base for getting out and about in Sydney on a big party weekend. I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Cate1955
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in April. We usually stay at Perouse Lodge in Randwick (our favourite Sydney accommodation).However we were attending a 60th birthday in Potts Point and decided to try out The Bayswater. This is a boutique hotel with various types of accommodation. We were fortunate to be upgraded to the deluxe room which was fantastic. Very comfortable king bed in a beautifully appointed and generous sized room with air-conditioning (which was great as our room was at the front of the building and we were there Friday and Saturday night so needed to shut the windows. The back rooms would possibly be quieter but not as spacious. There is a bus stop right outside the door that takes you right into the city and Circular Quay. The hotel is staffed 24/7 and the staff are all very professional and accommodating. We parked our car in a car park which was 5 minutes walk from the hotel and left it there for the duration. We got a discount on the parking and cost us $20 per day. You don't need a car as the public transport is so accessible. Do yourself a favour whilst you are there and walk down through Woolloomooloo and around the foreshore to the Opera House and the Rocks. A truly beautiful look at Sydney's gem - the harbour!! We will definitely stay at The Bayswater again for a terrific city experience. This hotel is one of a number of quality affordable hotels in the Randwick Lodges group. Really worth checking out their website for other options in the eastern Suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, modern and spotlessly clean and situated in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: uncloudedweather
Reviews.Content: I was on a tight budget & reluctant to 'slum' it in a hostel and share a bathroom etc..This place is no Hostel. The Bayswater was an awesome alternative and I had an extremely comfortable stay. Right in the middle of Kings Cross, its a bit funky, clean, with a really comfy bed, free wifi, foxtel, good lobby with lounges tea/coffee etc. and very helpul servive. As it was a saturday there were some groups of Kings Cross party-people going in and out of their rooms, but once I was in my modern cosy little room I hardly heard a thing. There is 24 hour reception, but no room service. Thats not a problem though because there are innumerable restraunts, bars, takeaway and other shops right outside the front door. I will certainly book here again

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: martinaloeb
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 nights and was very impressed with this place. It is right next to Kings Cross station, but it is actually up a little side street so you don't feel any of the hustle and bustle of the main street. We were upgraded for free without asking to a much bigger room and we were on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel (501 I think) and there was barely any noise from outside. The wifi is free but the connection is terribly slow. There is a computer in the lounge by reception that you can use for free and is quick. The only downfall other than the wifi is the fact that the reception staff are so varied in their level of customer service - ranging from good to none. The website says that there is a laundry room, but when we asked to use it we were told it was not ready yet and to go to one of the local laundrettes. When asked which one they told us to walk around and find one. We spent 20 mins doing just that and then went into the nearest hostel and asked for their recommendation - they googled for us and found us one right near the Bayswater! Overall, for the money we paid I was very happy with this place. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ali-mur-phy
Reviews.Content: The man at the front desk was really polite and helpful from the time of our booking, Its in a great spot and the room was small but very nice. Everything seems new and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: JB8080
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, and acts as a good base for seeing Sydney. The room is the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in and the bathroom is tiny. It is so small that you have to sit side saddle on the toilet. Also like other reviews it is really noisy outside and all the doors slam, so don't expect a quite night sleep - bring some ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm....not overjoyed but not unhappy either”
Reviews.Author: kittykatkittenwoteva
Reviews.Content: Looked nice from the outside, went in and I guess my first impression is tarnished because of the rude and arrongant male receptionist. I would admit that all other reception staff I encountered were lovely. Going upstairs to my room I must admitted I was a little suprised at the size of the room (or rather the box) I would be in. I don't mind having a super small room but it would have been could if i had expected it so maybe having approximate room dimensions on the website would be good. The room was tastefully decorated and quite impressive. One of the things I noticed was that in the folder all hotel rooms have you would normally find a little bit of handy information but this one has nothing in it?? Also 1 pen would have come in handy. Awesome location - and tbh i only actually slept in my room one night to ecperience how bad sleeping would be lol. Woken up by screaming at 2.30am and then woken up again by the trucks on the jobsite next door at 7am, not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Evaluation of a nearly good boutique hotel in Kings Cross, NSW”
Reviews.Author: jumpinjoe62
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel if internet access is vital to you. Staff is truly friendly and very courteous, but technically inept. Location was ideal for train access and night life. The room was plenty clean - just need for the cleaning staff to remember to properly service the room - multiple times they "forgot" to provide sufficient towels for two persons as well as the complimentary shampoo (it is a good brand - no complaints with the product, just the availability). The owner, Chris, was most uncooperative when it came to providing the "free internet service." He refused to make contact with me and the many other patrons who complained about the incompetent system - Chris just blew us off. Again, if service promised but not delivered is of no concern, you will certainly love this place! Rates are a bit high for the VERY LIMITED services you will get - takes time to chase down the cleaning staff to get things proper. Remember, you are in a hot spot (red light district) - it does get quite noisy until the wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: k3AScone
Reviews.Content: - The service was polite and friendly - The rooms were nice - The location was conveinient, close to the train station, easy to find. The amenities were very pleasent and attractive. - The best thing about The Bayswater was the conveinence of its location however the worst was how small the double room was everything was too close together even for one person to be staying.

Reviews.Title: “No security”
Reviews.Author: grech_phil
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but not quant. They were clean but the view was overlooking a brick wall. Beds were OK at best. My biggest issue was the security. Hotel is situated in the red light district of the city but yet management doesn't feel the need to have locks on the windows! There isn't even a lock box in the room. When I complained I was treated nicely but was basically brushed off. If younger looking for a little security when sleeping this place is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Understated....Boutique Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Miapeders83
Reviews.Content: I stay in Sydney on a monthly basis and love staying around the Cross and Potts point area for the great food and nightlife after long days of meetings.... I was a little unimpressed with lugging 40kgs of work luggage up the stairs to enter the hotel, and none of the staff even batted an eyelid and offered to help. Could say it soured my experience... The hotel itself is a charming boutique hotel not full of hookers (yet like Kirketon up the road is now) yet it definitely has the potential to be... unlike Hotel Diamant around the corner, this is a lot less flash, and more NY style than Potts Point style. The room was a King Deluxe - great view of the brick wall yet I have seen Sydney and want to sleep after a long day, not see what's outside as much. The lifts are so slow, so I recommend walking the stairs as it's quicker. The bed was huge and comfortable, with lovely homely touches like all the cushions and executive frills. The iPod dock never worked for me, and the TV was great. Awesome food around the corner, and the hotel is in a fantastic location if you need to drive to the East and the North with all main roads and toll roads nearby. I had a few doof doofers in the room over from me, with loud music blaring at 5am, yet hey, thats the Cross. Jazz up the service and this place would be really something!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and no stress”
Reviews.Author: Louise274
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights whilst in Sydney for business. Clean and quiet room (though guests in the room above had very heavy feet). A bonus to have opening widows, closing them did block out most of the noise from the busy street below. Almost total block out blinds - a must for me. Bed was comfortable enough and pillows were ok - I've had much worse. Free internet was brilliant. Modest reception, but friendly reception staff, though I didn't need much more than to check in and out and assistance with locating a car park. Car park about 5 mins walk away $30 for 24hrs - reception can give you directions. Easy walk to Potts Point restaurants and shops. Good cafe almost next door for breakfast. I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a weekend in kings cross”
Reviews.Author: ReneeAbroad
Reviews.Content: Met up with friends for a weekend of partying in sydney. We were looking for a place that was nice, in the heart of kings cross and reasonable value and this is what we got! The decor was very cool and well suited to that part of the city. Everything was spotlessly clean and new. Only real downfall was the lighting in the bathroom- was very dark- not a good spot to do your makeup before a night out! Will definitely stay here again if spending a weekend in the cross.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find fault, especially at the price”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningGentleman2
Reviews.Content: I booked a King Room the Bayswater after finding that my first choice, the Springfield Lodge, was pretty much full. They're both in the same group, called 'Sydney Lodges', although the Bayswater is by far the most upmarket. The cost was only a little more, and certainly cheaper than the other better hotels in the area such as the Quest and Regents Court, which are in turn cheaper than just about anywhere in the CBD. The room featured fairly standard modern hotel decor, but the colour palette was tasteful, and the matching woodgrain finish on the desk, cupboard, and side tables looked great. The number of throw pillows on the bed was quite absurd, however, especially as they all had to end up littering the floor when I wanted to sleep. Not a complaint as such, though. The (tiny) bathroom was done in a dark slate, which looked excellent but I suspect will not age all that well. The shower was large, and powerful. Annoyingly, there was no shower cap, and the reception were unable to furnish me with one. Speaking of reception, they were predominately foreign, pleasant and professional, and pretty relaxed in keeping with the establishment and neighbourhood. I have stayed around Kings Cross when in Sydney for years, and honestly never feel unsafe. The area is simply so busy, 24 hours a day, that you are always surrounded by people. Guzman y Gomez, a cheap but excellent Mexican place, is almost next door, and some great cafes and restaurants are down Macleay St - Fratelli Paradiso, Blanco, and Toby's Estate, just of the top of my head. Also some good stores for fashion and design, such as Macleay on Manning, and Arida. I was on the fourth floor, but at the very back, and there was some morning noise from the street behind. This, and the tiny shower cap-less bathroom are the only complaints I can muster, and they are minor. Although, I agree with the previous poster - it really isn't in Potts Point!

Reviews.Title: “it's Kings Cross, not quite Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: aurorasev
Reviews.Content: very well located for getting around opened only for a few weeks so everything bright and sharp The address is supposed to be in Potts Point which is a lovely leafy inner city suburb with nice little shops, however, the hotel is about 3 minutes walk from Kings Cross station with the attendant activities such as nightclubbing, bar hopping, soliciting, etc. There was no violence on the streets that I could see, however, wouldn't like to go around alone in evenings. A couple of problems: 1. reception (and lift) is on first floor of building which means carrying luggage upstairs by yourself (not a dorrman in sight) 2. found a panty in the room, obviously left by previous tenant 3. wireless did not work the whole time I was at the hotel 4. hotel has only 4 floors so for peace and quiet, go for the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new addition to Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: NickBrodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights - Thursday and Friday recently. The hotel had been open 2 weeks but beyond the phones not working there were no teething problems. This is an older building (formerly Barclay Hotel) that has been comprehensively rennovtaed. Not just a soft refurb but gutted and started again. The results is modern, funky and comfortable. Go for the largest room your budget allows - King size bed, lounge, desk, etc. Nice decor touches, great bathrooms of a decent size (tolietries selection is limited to shampoo, condition and soap) Great location right in the middle of the nightlife. Walking distance to everything. Open windows let the noise in but are quite effective at keeping it out when shut so it's surprisingly quiet. They have a deal with Kings Cross Parking Station for parking.

HotelInfo.Name: The Bayswater Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Bayswater Road | Kings Cross, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia
